execute.command: /bin/echo 'nameserver 155.98.60.2' | sudo /bin/csh -c '/bin/cat >> /etc/resolv.conf' && cd /local && sudo chmod 777 . && umask 002 && sudo rm -rf repository && sudo git config --system --add safe.directory /local/repository && git clone -n 'https://github.com/AKafakA/dodoor-cl-profile' repository && cd repository && git config --add core.sharedRepository group && git checkout 854898bbb4c65cd1be75fc44e674e0c443ef62d4 && git branch -ft main origin/main&& git checkout -B main HEAD && git submodule update --init --recursive&& sudo chown -R asdwb . && git remote set-url --push origin 'git@github.com:AKafakA/dodoor-cl-profile'

/bin/echo 'nameserver 155.98.60.2' | sudo /bin/csh -c '/bin/cat >> /etc/resolv.conf' && cd /local && sudo chmod 777 . && umask 002 && sudo rm -rf repository && sudo git config --system --add safe.directory /local/repository && git clone -n 'https://github.com/AKafakA/dodoor-cl-profile' repository && cd repository && git config --add core.sharedRepository group && git checkout 854898bbb4c65cd1be75fc44e674e0c443ef62d4 && git branch -ft main origin/main&& git checkout -B main HEAD && git submodule update --init --recursive&& sudo chown -R asdwb . && git remote set-url --push origin 'git@github.com:AKafakA/dodoor-cl-profile'
nohup java -cp dodoor/target/dodoor-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar edu.cam.dodoor.ServiceDaemon -c ~/dodoor/config.conf -d false -s false -n true 1>service.out 2>/dev/null &

rspec_tour.description:
This is a trivial example of a gitrepo-based profile; The profile source code and other software, documentation, etc. are stored in in a publicly accessible GIT repository (say, github.com). When you instantiate this profile, the repository is cloned to all of the nodes in your experiment, to `/local/repository`.
This particular profile is a simple example of using a single raw PC. It can be instantiated on any cluster; the node will boot the default operating system, which is typically a recent version of Ubuntu.
rspec_tour.instructions: Wait for the profile instance to start, then click on the node in the topology and choose the `shell` menu item.
